v.v: “Come, everyone who is thirsty, come to the water,
Why do you weigh out silver for what is not bread, and why do you labor for what does not satisfy?
Turn your ears and come to me! Listen, that you may live!
Look, I have placed him as a witness to the nations, as a leader and commander to the peoples.
Look, you will call to a nation that you did not know; and a nation that did not know you will run to you
Seek Yahweh while he may be found; call on him while he is nearby.
Let the wicked leave his path, and the man of sin his thoughts.
“For my thoughts are not your thoughts, nor are your ways my ways—this is Yahweh’s declaration—
for as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways, and my thoughts than your thoughts.
For as the rain and snow come down from heaven
so also my word will be that goes from my mouth—it will not return to me empty,
For you will go out in joy and be led along peacefully;
Instead of the thornbushes, the cypress will grow; and instead of the brier, the myrtle tree will grow,

v: and you who have no money, come, buy and eat!
Come, buy wine and milk without money and without cost.
Listen carefully to me and eat what is good, and delight yourselves in fatness.
I will make an everlasting covenant with you—my reliable, faithful love that I promised to David.
because of Yahweh your God, the Holy One of Israel, who has glorified you.”
Let him return to Yahweh, and he will pity him, and to our God, who will abundantly forgive him.
and do not return there unless they saturate the earth
and make it produce and sprout and give seed to the farmer who sows and bread to the eater,
but it will achieve the purpose for which I sent it.
the mountains and the hills will break out in joyful shouts before you, and all the trees of the fields will clap their hands.
and it will be for Yahweh, for his name, as an everlasting sign that will not be cut off.”
